channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: 'Devastating' funding crisis in Canadian sport is reaching a breaking point
item.description: For 20 years, core funding for sport from the federal government has not increased — even though inflation has caused prices to rise by more than 50 per cent. In recent months, some national sport organizations have been informed that their federal funding is set to be slashed.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: On Student Absences, Race-Based Data, Private Schools and More
item.description: A Q&A with academic Kelly Gallagher-Mackay on some big questions facing public education in Canada.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘This is a big deal’: Health Canada approves 1st drug to slow Alzheimer's disease
item.description: The treatment, lecanemab, has already been approved in some other countries, including the U.S., the U.K., Japan, Mexico and China.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: B.C. man charged in Ontario serial sexual assault cold case
item.description: Ontario Provincial Police say a British Columbia man has been charged in connection with a series of violent sexual assaults that happened nearly three decades ago across southwestern Ontario.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ontario government signs agreement with Webequie First Nation for road to Ring of Fire
item.description: Ontario has signed a community partnership agreement with Webequie First Nation in an effort to speed up development in the Ring of Fire. The huge mineral deposit in the James Bay lowlands has long been a key source for the EV battery industry, but a First Nations alliance has been critical of the government’s approach. Here's what we know about the new agreement and what it means for development.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Sask. NDP calls for public inquiry into wildfire response as public safety minister faces calls to resign
item.description: The Opposition NDP's effort to establish an independent public inquiry into the government's response to a wildfire that ravaged a northern Saskatchewan village this summer has been blocked.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Quebec's pain, Ontario and N.B.'s gain? Doctors look to leave province over new forced deal
item.description: The fallout continues after the Quebec government invoked closure over the weekend to force a new remuneration system on doctors, with many physicians already inquiring about opportunities in other provinces.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: N.S. man charged in sex assault dating back almost 22 years: RCMP
item.description: RCMP said a Nova Scotia man has been arrested and charged for a sexual assault that police allege took place almost 22 years ago when the victim was a child.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada Post Minister Says He’s Ready to Allow Big Job Cuts
item.description: Experts say at least 10,000 jobs could be lost to changes at the Crown corporation.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Bank of Canada has lowered its key interest rate. What does it mean for you?
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ontario premier urges U.S. ambassador to ‘bury the hatchet,’ apologize after profane tirade
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Why some farmers are turning old grain bins into guest houses
item.description: Some Alberta ranchers hope that branching into tourism will help shore up their family farms to last another generation — though the accommodations might seem a little quirky.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Accepts All Recommendations From Independent Review of The Planning Amendment Act and The City of Winnipeg Charter Amendment Act (Bill 37)

item.title: Manitoba Government Adds 800 Teachers in Two Years

item.title: More than 500 people pack Richmond hotel to learn about Cowichan Nation land ruling
item.description: In August, British Columbia's Supreme Court granted the Quw’utsun Nation (Cowichan Nation) Aboriginal title over 5.7 km of land in Richmond.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: There's still time to win a Canadian getaway—and support B.C.’s hospitality workers
item.description: Two days left to support BC hospitality workers.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Danielle Smith Brings Down the Hammer on Alberta’s Teachers
item.description: The government rams through a back-to-work law and removes their Charter rights.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Alberta's plan to add ‘Strong and Free' on licence plates hits trademark speed bump
item.description: The change of slogan on Alberta's licence plates from 'Wild Rose Country' to 'Strong and Free' could possibly violate the trademark a New Brunswick business has held since 2022.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ford to Quebec doctors amid compensation dispute: ‘Call me'
item.description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford is telling Quebec doctors to give him a call as some consider moving to other provinces over a compensation dispute.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Billion-dollar government deals with Stellantis, NextStar for EV battery plant revealed
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: $510M in lawyers' fees in treaty case unreasonable, judge says
item.description: The Ontario judge ruled the $510 million in lawyer fees for the treaty case was unreasonable and ordered it scaled back to $23 million.

item.title: Danielle Smith uses notwithstanding clause to end Alberta teachers' strike

item.title: Heart of the City Festival showcases the Downtown Eastside's commitment to building community
item.description: "These are real people, with real feelings.”

item.title: Tony Wakeham sworn in as N.L’.s 16th premier
item.description: Premier Tony Wakeham and his cabinet were sworn in on Wednesday morning at Government House in St. John's.

item.title: ‘This is not a joke': New Brunswick city reschedules Halloween, draws mixed reaction
item.description: A New Brunswick city has made the decision to postpone trick-or-treating this year because of a wet and windy forecast, but not everyone is in agreement.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: New N.L. premier promises to launch review of Hydro-Québec deal within weeks
item.description: Newfoundland and Labrador Premier Tony Wakeham says a review of the proposed Hydro-Québec energy deal will begin within weeks to ensure it’s the best deal for the province.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
